ygData.subject: Re: PoF pulling
ygData.msgSnippet: I like the idea of CT DT.  I played a mud where a god on there could not only just kill people like this, but could decide that he would cast an AE spell
ygData.messageBody:
I like the idea of CT DT. I played a mud where a god on there could
not only just kill people like this, but could decide that he would cast
an AE spell continuously until everything was dead. Yes, upsetting
when we first experienced it, but oh that was soo much fun
when we do win.

Theory 1:
Power is limited, even for gods. Not even gods have unlimitd
charges of anything they want.

Theory 2:
Power is unlimited, but gods must abide by some fair fight rules
set down before time was time.

Theory 3:
Make up your own reasoning so that it pleases you, don't use mine.

>
> Think for a moment. If CT *really* had a death touch, what
> would he do the moment he discovered mortals were messing
> around in his realm? DT all of them. Isn't that what *you'd*
> do if you were playing CT? If you want a balanced (i.e. fun)
> game, you can't go willy nilly giving mobs all sorts of
> super-powers.
>
You were doing so well... then this paragraph.

1. Why have denizens if anytime anything comes you insta-kill? let
your pets have some fun.

2. Yes. Stop giving these gods all sorts of god-like powers! What
are you thinking? *grin*

Ludvaraman --
